intro: Elsholtzia incisa, commonly known as Chinese germander, is a perennial herb native to regions of China, Mongolia, and the Russian Far East. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, aromatic stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. The plant produces small, tubular flowers in shades of pink to purple, arranged in dense clusters at the ends of the branches. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or arid environments. Elsholtzia incisa is valued for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional Chinese medicine.
